text: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the beginning with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: All things came into being through him, and without him not one thing came into being. What has come into being
speaker: Narrator

text: in him was life, and the life was the light of all people.
speaker: Narrator

text: The light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not overtake it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a man sent from God whose name was John.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came as a witness to testify to the light, so that all might believe through him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He himself was not the light, but he came to testify to the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: The true light, which enlightens everyone, was coming into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was in the world, and the world came into being through him, yet the world did not know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to what was his own, and his own people did not accept him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to all who received him, who believed in his name, he gave power to become children of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who were born, not of blood or of the will of the flesh or of the will of man, but of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Word became flesh and lived among us, and we have seen his glory, the glory as of a father’s only son, full of grace and truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: (John testified to him and cried out, “This was he of whom I said, ‘He who comes after me ranks ahead of me because he was before me.’ ”)
speaker: Narrator

text: From his fullness we have all received, grace upon grace.
speaker: Narrator

text: The law indeed was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has ever seen God. It is the only Son, himself God, who is close to the Father’s heart, who has made him known.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the testimony given by John when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He confessed and did not deny it, but he confessed, “I am not the Messiah.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And they asked him, “What then? Are you Elijah?” He said, “I am not.” “Are you the prophet?” He answered, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “Who are you? Let us have an answer for those who sent us. What do you say about yourself?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said,
“I am the voice of one crying out in the wilderness,
‘Make straight the way of the Lord,’ ”
as the prophet Isaiah said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they had been sent from the Pharisees.
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, “Why, then, are you baptizing if you are neither the Messiah, nor Elijah, nor the prophet?”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered them, “I baptize with water. Among you stands one whom you do not know,
speaker: Narrator

text: the one who is coming after me; I am not worthy to untie the strap of his sandal.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This took place in Bethany across the Jordan where John was baptizing.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day he saw Jesus coming toward him and declared, “Here is the Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
speaker: Narrator

text: This is he of whom I said, ‘After me comes a man who ranks ahead of me because he was before me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I myself did not know him, but I came baptizing with water for this reason, that he might be revealed to Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And John testified, “I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it remained on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I myself did not know him, but the one who sent me to baptize with water said to me, ‘He on whom you see the Spirit descend and remain is the one who baptizes with the Holy Spirit.’
speaker: Narrator

text: And I myself have seen and have testified that this is the Chosen One.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day John again was standing with two of his disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and as he watched Jesus walk by he exclaimed, “Look, here is the Lamb of God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The two disciples heard him say this, and they followed Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus turned and saw them following, he said to them, “What are you looking for?” They said to him, “Rabbi” (which translated means Teacher), “where are you staying?”
speaker: Jesus

text: He said to them, “Come and see.” They came and saw where he was staying, and they remained with him that day. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon.
speaker: Jesus

text: One of the two who heard John speak and followed him was Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: He first found his brother Simon and said to him, “We have found the Messiah” (which is translated Anointed).
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought Simon to Jesus, who looked at him and said, “You are Simon son of John. You are to be called Cephas” (which is translated Peter).
speaker: Jesus

text: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Follow me.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Now Philip was from Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip found Nathanael and said to him, “We have found him about whom Moses in the Law and also the Prophets wrote, Jesus son of Joseph from Nazareth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nathanael said to him, “Can anything good come out of Nazareth?” Philip said to him, “Come and see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw Nathanael coming toward him, he said of him, “Here is truly an Israelite in whom there is no deceit!”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael asked him, “Where did you get to know me?” Jesus answered, “I saw you under the fig tree before Philip called you.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nathanael replied, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God! You are the King of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Do you believe because I told you that I saw you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than these.”
speaker: Jesus

text: And he said to him, “Very truly, I tell you, you will see heaven opened and the angels of God ascending and descending upon the Son of Man.”
speaker: Jesus

text: On the third day there was a wedding in Cana of Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus and his disciples had also been invited to the wedding.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the wine gave out, the mother of Jesus said to him, “They have no wine.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jesus said to her, “Woman, what concern is that to me and to you? My hour has not yet come.”
speaker: Jesus

text: His mother said to the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now standing there were six stone water jars for the Jewish rites of purification, each holding twenty or thirty gallons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Fill the jars with water.” And they filled them up to the brim.
speaker: Jesus

text: He said to them, “Now draw some out, and take it to the person in charge of the banquet.” So they took it.
speaker: Jesus

text: When the person in charge tasted the water that had become wine and did not know where it came from (though the servants who had drawn the water knew), that person called the bridegroom
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to him, “Everyone serves the good wine first and then the inferior wine after the guests have become drunk. But you have kept the good wine until now.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Jesus did this, the first of his signs, in Cana of Galilee and revealed his glory, and his disciples believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this he went down to Capernaum with his mother, his brothers, and his disciples, and they remained there a few days.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Passover of the Jews was near, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the temple he found people selling cattle, sheep, and doves and the money changers seated at their tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: Making a whip of cords, he drove all of them out of the temple, with the sheep and the cattle. He also poured out the coins of the money changers and overturned their tables.
speaker: Narrator

text: He told those who were selling the doves, “Take these things out of here! Stop making my Father’s house a marketplace!”
speaker: Jesus

text: His disciples remembered that it was written, “Zeal for your house will consume me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then said to him, “What sign can you show us for doing this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The Jews then said, “This temple has been under construction for forty-six years, and will you raise it up in three days?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he was speaking of the temple of his body.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this, and they believed the scripture and the word that Jesus had spoken.
speaker: Jesus

text: When he was in Jerusalem during the Passover festival, many believed in his name because they saw the signs that he was doing.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus on his part would not entrust himself to them, because he knew all people
speaker: Narrator

text: and needed no one to testify about anyone, for he himself knew what was in everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a Pharisee named Nicodemus, a leader of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to Jesus by night and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher who has come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do unless God is with that person.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “Very truly, I tell you, no one can see the kingdom of God without being born from above.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said to him, “How can anyone be born after having grown old? Can one enter a second time into the mother’s womb and be born?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Very truly, I tell you, no one can enter the kingdom of God without being born of water and Spirit.
speaker: Jesus

text: What is born of the flesh is flesh, and what is born of the Spirit is spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be astonished that I said to you, ‘You must be born from above.’
speaker: Jesus

text: The wind blows where it chooses, and you hear the sound of it, but you do not know where it comes from or where it goes. So it is with everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
speaker: Jesus

text: Nicodemus said to him, “How can these things be?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and yet you do not understand these things?
speaker: Jesus

text: “Very truly, I tell you, we speak of what we know and testify to what we have seen, yet you do not receive our testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: If I have told you about earthly things and you do not believe, how can you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
speaker: Jesus

text: No one has ascended into heaven except the one who descended from heaven, the Son of Man.
speaker: Jesus

text: And just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
speaker: Jesus

text: that whoever believes in him may have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: “For God so loved the world that he gave his only Son, so that everyone who believes in him may not perish but may have eternal life.
speaker: Jesus

text: “Indeed, God did not send the Son into the world to condemn the world but in order that the world might be saved through him.
speaker: Jesus

text: Those who believe in him are not condemned, but those who do not believe are condemned already because they have not believed in the name of the only Son of God.
speaker: Jesus

text: And this is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and people loved darkness rather than light because their deeds were evil.
speaker: Jesus

text: For all who do evil hate the light and do not come to the light, so that their deeds may not be exposed.
speaker: Jesus

text: But those who do what is true come to the light, so that it may be clearly seen that their deeds have been done in God.”
speaker: Jesus

text: After this Jesus and his disciples went into the region of Judea, and he spent some time there with them and baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: John also was baptizing at Aenon near Salim because water was abundant there, and people kept coming and were being baptized.
speaker: Narrator

text: (John, of course, had not yet been thrown into prison.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a discussion about purification arose between John’s disciples and a Jew.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, the one who was with you across the Jordan, to whom you testified, here he is baptizing, and all are going to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: John answered, “No one can receive anything except what has been given from heaven.
speaker: Jesus

text: You yourselves are my witnesses that I said, ‘I am not the Messiah, but I have been sent ahead of him.’
speaker: Jesus

text: He who has the bride is the bridegroom. The friend of the bridegroom who stands and hears him rejoices greatly at the bridegroom’s voice. For this reason my joy has been fulfilled.
speaker: Jesus

text: He must increase, but I must decrease.”
speaker: Jesus

text: The one who comes from above is above all; the one who is of the earth belongs to the earth and speaks about earthly things. The one who comes from heaven is above all.
speaker: Jesus

text: He testifies to what he has seen and heard, yet no one accepts his testimony.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever has accepted his testimony has certified this, that God is true.
speaker: Jesus

text: He whom God has sent speaks the words of God, for he gives the Spirit without measure.
speaker: Jesus

text: The Father loves the Son and has placed all things in his hands.
speaker: Jesus

text: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life; whoever disobeys the Son will not see life but must endure God’s wrath.
speaker: Jesus

text: Now when Jesus learned that the Pharisees had heard, “Jesus is making and baptizing more disciples than John”
speaker: Narrator

text: (although it was not Jesus himself but his disciples who baptized),
speaker: Narrator

text: he left Judea and started back to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he had to go through Samaria.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he came to a Samaritan city called Sychar, near the plot of ground that Jacob had given to his son Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jacob’s well was there, and Jesus, tired out by his journey, was sitting by the well. It was about noon.
speaker: Narrator

text: A Samaritan woman came to draw water, and Jesus said to her, “Give me a drink.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (His disciples had gone to the city to buy food.)
speaker: Narrator

text: The Samaritan woman said to him, “How is it that you, a Jew, ask a drink of me, a woman of Samaria?” (Jews do not share things in common with Samaritans.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered her, “If you knew the gift of God and who it is that is saying to you, ‘Give me a drink,’ you would have asked him, and he would have given you living water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to him, “Sir, you have no bucket, and the well is deep. Where do you get that living water?
speaker: Narrator

text: Are you greater than our ancestor Jacob, who gave us the well and with his sons and his flocks drank from it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Everyone who drinks of this water will be thirsty again,
speaker: Narrator

text: but those who drink of the water that I will give them will never be thirsty. The water that I will give will become in them a spring of water gushing up to eternal life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to him, “Sir, give me this water, so that I may never be thirsty or have to keep coming here to draw water.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Go, call your husband, and come back.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman answered him, “I have no husband.” Jesus said to her, “You are right in saying, ‘I have no husband,’
speaker: Narrator

text: for you have had five husbands, and the one you have now is not your husband. What you have said is true!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to him, “Sir, I see that you are a prophet.
speaker: Narrator

text: Our ancestors worshiped on this mountain, but you say that the place where people must worship is in Jerusalem.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, believe me, the hour is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: You worship what you do not know; we worship what we know, for salvation is from the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the hour is coming and is now here when the true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and truth, for the Father seeks such as these to worship him.
speaker: Narrator

text: God is spirit, and those who worship him must worship in spirit and truth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to him, “I know that Messiah is coming” (who is called Christ). “When he comes, he will proclaim all things to us.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “I am he, the one who is speaking to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Just then his disciples came. They were astonished that he was speaking with a woman, but no one said, “What do you want?” or, “Why are you speaking with her?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the woman left her water jar and went back to the city. She said to the people,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Come and see a man who told me everything I have ever done! He cannot be the Messiah, can he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They left the city and were on their way to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Meanwhile the disciples were urging him, “Rabbi, eat something.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “I have food to eat that you do not know about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the disciples said to one another, “Surely no one has brought him something to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “My food is to do the will of him who sent me and to complete his work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not say, ‘Four months more, then comes the harvest’? But I tell you, look around you, and see how the fields are ripe for harvesting.
speaker: Narrator

text: The reaper is already receiving wages and is gathering fruit for eternal life, so that sower and reaper may rejoice together.
speaker: Narrator

text: For here the saying holds true, ‘One sows and another reaps.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent you to reap that for which you did not labor. Others have labored, and you have entered into their labor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many Samaritans from that city believed in him because of the woman’s testimony, “He told me everything I have ever done.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the Samaritans came to him, they asked him to stay with them, and he stayed there two days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And many more believed because of his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to the woman, “It is no longer because of what you said that we believe, for we have heard for ourselves, and we know that this is truly the Savior of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the two days were over, he went from that place to Galilee
speaker: Narrator

text: (for Jesus himself had testified that a prophet has no honor in the prophet’s own country).
speaker: Narrator

text: When he came to Galilee, the Galileans welcomed him, since they had seen all that he had done in Jerusalem at the festival, for they, too, had gone to the festival.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he came again to Cana in Galilee, where he had changed the water into wine. Now there was a royal official whose son lay ill in Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went and begged him to come down and heal his son, for he was at the point of death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to him, “Unless you see signs and wonders you will not believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The official said to him, “Sir, come down before my little boy dies.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Go; your son will live.” The man believed the word that Jesus spoke to him and started on his way.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was going down, his slaves met him and told him that his child was alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: So he asked them the hour when he began to recover, and they said to him, “Yesterday at one in the afternoon the fever left him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The father realized that this was the hour when Jesus had said to him, “Your son will live.” So he himself believed, along with his whole household.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now this was the second sign that Jesus did after coming from Judea to Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this there was a festival of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in Jerusalem by the Sheep Gate there is a pool, called in Hebrew Beth-zatha, which has five porticoes.
speaker: Narrator

text: In these lay many ill, blind, lame, and paralyzed people.
speaker: Narrator

text: One man was there who had been ill for thirty-eight years.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw him lying there and knew that he had been there a long time, he said to him, “Do you want to be made well?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The ill man answered him, “Sir, I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is stirred up, and while I am making my way someone else steps down ahead of me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Stand up, take your mat and walk.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
At once the man was made well, and he took up his mat and began to walk.
Now that day was a Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews said to the man who had been cured, “It is the Sabbath; it is not lawful for you to carry your mat.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But he answered them, “The man who made me well said to me, ‘Take up your mat and walk.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: They asked him, “Who is the man who said to you, ‘Take it up and walk’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the man who had been healed did not know who it was, for Jesus had disappeared in the crowd that was there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Later Jesus found him in the temple and said to him, “See, you have been made well! Do not sin any more, so that nothing worse happens to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man went away and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had made him well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Jews started persecuting Jesus, because he was doing such things on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus answered them, “My Father is still working, and I also am working.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason the Jews were seeking all the more to kill him, because he was not only breaking the Sabbath but was also calling God his own Father, thereby making himself equal to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Very truly, I tell you, the Son can do nothing on his own but only what he sees the Father doing, for whatever the Father does, the Son does likewise.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Father loves the Son and shows him all that he himself is doing, and he will show him greater works than these, so that you will be astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, just as the Father raises the dead and gives them life, so also the Son gives life to whomever he wishes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Father judges no one but has given all judgment to the Son,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all may honor the Son just as they honor the Father. Anyone who does not honor the Son does not honor the Father who sent him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, anyone who hears my word and believes him who sent me has eternal life and does not come under judgment but has passed from death to life.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Very truly, I tell you, the hour is coming and is now here when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those who hear will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: For just as the Father has life in himself, so he has granted the Son also to have life in himself,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he has given him authority to execute judgment because he is the Son of Man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be astonished at this, for the hour is coming when all who are in their graves will hear his voice
speaker: Narrator

text: and will come out: those who have done good to the resurrection of life, and those who have done evil to the resurrection of condemnation.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I can do nothing on my own. As I hear, I judge, and my judgment is just because I seek to do not my own will but the will of him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If I testify about myself, my testimony is not true.
speaker: Narrator

text: There is another who testifies on my behalf, and I know that his testimony to me is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: You sent messengers to John, and he testified to the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that I accept such human testimony, but I say these things so that you may be saved.
speaker: Narrator

text: He was a burning and shining lamp, and you were willing to rejoice for a while in his light.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I have a testimony greater than John’s. The works that the Father has given me to complete, the very works that I am doing, testify on my behalf that the Father has sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Father who sent me has himself testified on my behalf. You have never heard his voice or seen his form,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you do not have his word abiding in you, because you do not believe him whom he has sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You search the scriptures because you think that in them you have eternal life, and it is they that testify on my behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet you refuse to come to me to have life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not accept glory from humans.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I know that you do not have the love of God in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come in my Father’s name, and you do not accept me; if another comes in his own name, you will accept him.
speaker: Narrator

text: How can you believe when you accept glory from one another and do not seek the glory that comes from the one who alone is God?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not think that I will accuse you before the Father; your accuser is Moses, on whom you have set your hope.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you believed Moses, you would believe me, for he wrote about me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you do not believe what he wrote, how will you believe what I say?”
speaker: Narrator

text: After this Jesus went to the other side of the Sea of Galilee, also called the Sea of Tiberias.
speaker: Narrator

text: A large crowd kept following him because they saw the signs that he was doing for the sick.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus went up the mountain and sat down there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Passover, the festival of the Jews, was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he looked up and saw a large crowd coming toward him, Jesus said to Philip, “Where are we to buy bread for these people to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said this to test him, for he himself knew what he was going to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip answered him, “Two hundred denarii would not buy enough bread for each of them to get a little.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of his disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, said to him,
speaker: Narrator

text: “There is a boy here who has five barley loaves and two fish. But what are they among so many people?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Make the people sit down.” Now there was a great deal of grass in the place, so they sat down, about five thousand in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus took the loaves, and when he had given thanks he distributed them to those who were seated; so also the fish, as much as they wanted.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they were satisfied, he told his disciples, “Gather up the fragments left over, so that nothing may be lost.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gathered them up, and from the fragments of the five barley loaves, left by those who had eaten, they filled twelve baskets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people saw the sign that he had done, they began to say, “This is indeed the prophet who is to come into the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus realized that they were about to come and take him by force to make him king, he withdrew again to the mountain by himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: When evening came, his disciples went down to the sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: got into a boat, and started across the sea to Capernaum. It was now dark, and Jesus had not yet come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sea became rough because a strong wind was blowing.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had rowed about three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the sea and coming near the boat, and they were terrified.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said to them, “It is I; do not be afraid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they wanted to take him into the boat, and immediately the boat reached the land toward which they were going.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day the crowd that had stayed on the other side of the sea saw that there had been only one boat there. They also saw that Jesus had not gotten into the boat with his disciples but that his disciples had gone away alone.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some boats from Tiberias came near the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
speaker: Narrator

text: So when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they themselves got into the boats and went to Capernaum looking for Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they found him on the other side of the sea, they said to him, “Rabbi, when did you come here?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Very truly, I tell you, you are looking for me not because you saw signs but because you ate your fill of the loaves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not work for the food that perishes but for the food that endures for eternal life, which the Son of Man will give you. For it is on him that God the Father has set his seal.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “What must we do to perform the works of God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “This is the work of God, that you believe in him whom he has sent.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said to him, “What sign are you going to give us, then, so that we may see it and believe you? What work are you performing?
speaker: Narrator

text: Our ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, as it is written, ‘He gave them bread from heaven to eat.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to them, “Very truly, I tell you, it was not Moses who gave you the bread from heaven, but it is my Father who gives you the true bread from heaven.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the bread of God is that which comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Sir, give us this bread always.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never be hungry, and whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.
speaker: Narrator

text: But I said to you that you have seen me and yet do not believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everything that the Father gives me will come to me, and anyone who comes to me I will never drive away,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have come down from heaven not to do my own will but the will of him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the will of him who sent me, that I should lose nothing of all that he has given me but raise it up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is indeed the will of my Father, that all who see the Son and believe in him may have eternal life, and I will raise them up on the last day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews began to complain about him because he said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They were saying, “Is not this Jesus, the son of Joseph, whose father and mother we know? How can he now say, ‘I have come down from heaven’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Do not complain among yourselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one can come to me unless drawn by the Father who sent me, and I will raise that person up on the last day.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is written in the prophets, ‘And they shall all be taught by God.’ Everyone who has heard and learned from the Father comes to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Not that anyone has seen the Father except the one who is from God; he has seen the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, whoever believes has eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the bread of life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your ancestors ate the manna in the wilderness, and they died.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread that comes down from heaven, so that one may eat of it and not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Whoever eats of this bread will live forever, and the bread that I will give for the life of the world is my flesh.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews then disputed among themselves, saying, “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said to them, “Very truly, I tell you, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you have no life in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood have eternal life, and I will raise them up on the last day,
speaker: Narrator

text: for my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who eat my flesh and drink my blood abide in me and I in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just as the living Father sent me and I live because of the Father, so whoever eats me will live because of me.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the bread that came down from heaven, not like that which the ancestors ate, and they died. But the one who eats this bread will live forever.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said these things while he was teaching in a synagogue at Capernaum.
speaker: Narrator

text: When many of his disciples heard it, they said, “This teaching is difficult; who can accept it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Jesus, being aware that his disciples were complaining about it, said to them, “Does this offend you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then what if you were to see the Son of Man ascending to where he was before?
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the spirit that gives life; the flesh is useless. The words that I have spoken to you are spirit and life.
speaker: Narrator

text: But among you there are some who do not believe.” For Jesus knew from the beginning who were the ones who did not believe and who was the one who would betray him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “For this reason I have told you that no one can come to me unless it is granted by the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of this many of his disciples turned back and no longer went about with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus asked the twelve, “Do you also wish to go away?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter answered him, “Lord, to whom can we go? You have the words of eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: We have come to believe and know that you are the Holy One of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Did I not choose you, the twelve? Yet one of you is a devil.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He was speaking of Judas son of Simon Iscariot, for he, though one of the twelve, was going to betray him.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this Jesus went about in Galilee. He did not wish to go about in Judea because the Jews were looking for an opportunity to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Jewish Festival of Booths was near.
speaker: Narrator

text: So his brothers said to him, “Leave here and go to Judea so that your disciples also may see the works you are doing,
speaker: Narrator

text: for no one who wants to be widely known acts in secret. If you do these things, show yourself to the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (For not even his brothers believed in him.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “My time has not yet come, but your time is always here.
speaker: Narrator

text: The world cannot hate you, but it hates me because I testify against it that its works are evil.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go to the festival yourselves. I am not going to this festival, for my time has not yet fully come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After saying this, he remained in Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text: But after his brothers had gone to the festival, then he also went, not publicly but, as it were, in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews were looking for him at the festival and saying, “Where is he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was considerable complaining about him among the crowds. While some were saying, “He is a good man,” others were saying, “No, he is deceiving the crowd.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet no one would speak openly about him for fear of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: About the middle of the festival Jesus went up into the temple and began to teach.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews were astonished at it, saying, “How does this man have such learning, when he has never been taught?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus answered them, “My teaching is not mine but his who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Anyone who resolves to do the will of God will know whether the teaching is from God or whether I am speaking on my own.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who speak on their own seek their own glory, but the one who seeks the glory of him who sent him is true, and there is nothing unjust in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Did not Moses give you the law? Yet none of you keeps the law. Why are you looking for an opportunity to kill me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd answered, “You have a demon! Who is trying to kill you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “I performed one work, and all of you are astonished.
speaker: Narrator

text: Because of this Moses gave you circumcision (it is, of course, not from Moses but from the patriarchs), and you circumcise a man on the Sabbath.
speaker: Narrator

text: If a man receives circumcision on the Sabbath in order that the law of Moses may not be broken, are you angry with me because I healed a man’s whole body on the Sabbath?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not judge by appearances, but judge with right judgment.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now some of the people of Jerusalem were saying, “Is not this the man whom they are trying to kill?
speaker: Narrator

text: And here he is, speaking openly, but they say nothing to him! Can it be that the authorities really know that this is the Messiah?
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet we know where this man is from, but when the Messiah comes no one will know where he is from.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus cried out as he was teaching in the temple, “You know me, and you know where I am from. I have not come on my own. But the one who sent me is true, and you do not know him.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know him because I am from him, and he sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they tried to arrest him, but no one laid hands on him because his hour had not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet many in the crowd believed in him and were saying, “When the Messiah comes, will he do more signs than this man has done?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees heard the crowd muttering such things about him, and the chief priests and Pharisees sent temple police to arrest him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus then said, “I will be with you a little while longer, and then I am going to him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: You will search for me, but you will not find me, and where I am, you cannot come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews said to one another, “Where does this man intend to go that we will not find him? Does he intend to go to the dispersion among the Greeks and teach the Greeks?
speaker: Narrator

text: What does he mean by saying, ‘You will search for me, but you will not find me’ and ‘Where I am, you cannot come’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the last day of the festival, the great day, while Jesus was standing there, he cried out, “Let anyone who is thirsty come to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: and let the one who believes in me drink. As the scripture has said, ‘Out of the believer’s heart shall flow rivers of living water.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he said this about the Spirit, which believers in him were to receive, for as yet there was no Spirit because Jesus was not yet glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard these words, some in the crowd said, “This is really the prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others said, “This is the Messiah.” But some asked, “Surely the Messiah does not come from Galilee, does he?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has not the scripture said that the Messiah is descended from David and comes from Bethlehem, the village where David lived?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So there was a division in the crowd because of him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of them wanted to arrest him, but no one laid hands on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the temple police went back to the chief priests and Pharisees, who asked them, “Why did you not arrest him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The police answered, “Never has anyone spoken like this!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees replied, “Surely you have not been deceived, too, have you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Has any one of the authorities or of the Pharisees believed in him?
speaker: Narrator

text: But this crowd, which does not know the law, they are accursed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus, who had gone to Jesus before and who was one of them, asked,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Our law does not judge people without first giving them a hearing to find out what they are doing, does it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They replied, “Surely you are not also from Galilee, are you? Search and you will see that no prophet is to arise from Galilee.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then each of them went home,
speaker: Narrator

text: while Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early in the morning he came again to the temple. All the people came to him, and he sat down and began to teach them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The scribes and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in adultery, and, making her stand before all of them,
speaker: Narrator

text: they said to him, “Teacher, this woman was caught in the very act of committing adultery.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the law Moses commanded us to stone such women. Now what do you say?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said this to test him, so that they might have some charge to bring against him. Jesus bent down and wrote with his finger on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they kept on questioning him, he straightened up and said to them, “Let anyone among you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone at her.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And once again he bent down and wrote on the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they heard it, they went away, one by one, beginning with the elders, and Jesus was left alone with the woman standing before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus straightened up and said to her, “Woman, where are they? Has no one condemned you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said, “No one, sir.” And Jesus said, “Neither do I condemn you. Go your way, and from now on do not sin again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Jesus spoke to them, saying, “I am the light of the world. Whoever follows me will never walk in darkness but will have the light of life.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees said to him, “You are testifying on your own behalf; your testimony is not valid.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Even if I testify on my own behalf, my testimony is valid because I know where I have come from and where I am going, but you do not know where I come from or where I am going.
speaker: Narrator

text: You judge by human standards; I judge no one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet even if I do judge, my judgment is valid, for it is not I alone who judge but I and the Father who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In your law it is written that the testimony of two witnesses is valid.
speaker: Narrator

text: I testify on my own behalf, and the Father who sent me testifies on my behalf.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they said to him, “Where is your Father?” Jesus answered, “You know neither me nor my Father. If you knew me, you would know my Father also.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He spoke these words while he was teaching in the treasury of the temple, but no one arrested him, because his hour had not yet come.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he said to them, “I am going away, and you will search for me, but you will die in your sin. Where I am going, you cannot come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said, “Is he going to kill himself? Is that what he means by saying, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “You are from below, I am from above; you are from this world, I am not from this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: I told you that you would die in your sins, for you will die in your sins unless you believe that I am he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Who are you?” Jesus said to them, “Why do I speak to you at all?
speaker: Narrator

text: I have much to say about you and much to condemn, but the one who sent me is true, and I declare to the world what I have heard from him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They did not understand that he was speaking to them about the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus said, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will realize that I am he and that I do nothing on my own, but I speak these things as the Father instructed me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the one who sent me is with me; he has not left me alone, for I always do what is pleasing to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As he was saying these things, many believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus said to the Jews who had believed in him, “If you continue in my word, you are truly my disciples,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will know the truth, and the truth will make you free.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, “We are descendants of Abraham and have never been slaves to anyone. What do you mean by saying, ‘You will be made free’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Very truly, I tell you, everyone who commits sin is a slave to sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: The slave does not have a permanent place in the household; the son has a place there forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if the Son makes you free, you will be free indeed.
speaker: Narrator

text: I know that you are descendants of Abraham, yet you look for an opportunity to kill me because there is no place in you for my word.
speaker: Narrator

text: I declare what I have seen in the Father’s presence; as for you, you should do what you have heard from the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, “Abraham is our father.” Jesus said to them, “If you are Abraham’s children, you would do what Abraham did,
speaker: Narrator

text: but now you are trying to kill me, a man who has told you the truth that I heard from God. This is not what Abraham did.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are indeed doing what your father does.” They said to him, “We are not illegitimate children; we have one Father, God himself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “If God were your Father, you would love me, for I came from God, and now I am here. I did not come on my own, but he sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you not understand what I say? It is because you cannot accept my word.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are from your father the devil, and you choose to do your father’s desires. He was a murderer from the beginning and does not stand in the truth because there is no truth in him. When he lies, he speaks according to his own nature, for he is a liar and the father of lies.
speaker: Narrator

text: But because I tell the truth, you do not believe me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Which of you convicts me of sin? If I tell the truth, why do you not believe me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever is from God hears the words of God. The reason you do not hear them is that you are not from God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered him, “Are we not right in saying that you are a Samaritan and have a demon?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I do not have a demon, but I honor my Father, and you dishonor me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet I do not seek my own glory; there is one who seeks it, and he is the judge.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, whoever keeps my word will never see death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews said to him, “Now we know that you have a demon. Abraham died, and so did the prophets, yet you say, ‘Whoever keeps my word will never taste death.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Are you greater than our father Abraham, who died? The prophets also died. Who do you claim to be?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “If I glorify myself, my glory is nothing. It is my Father who glorifies me, he of whom you say, ‘He is our God,’
speaker: Narrator

text: though you do not know him. But I know him; if I would say that I do not know him, I would be a liar like you. But I do know him, and I keep his word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your ancestor Abraham rejoiced that he would see my day; he saw it and was glad.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Jews said to him, “You are not yet fifty years old, and have you seen Abraham?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Very truly, I tell you, before Abraham was, I am.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they picked up stones to throw at him, but Jesus hid himself and went out of the temple.
speaker: Narrator

text: As he walked along, he saw a man blind from birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples asked him, “Rabbi, who sinned, this man or his parents, that he was born blind?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Neither this man nor his parents sinned; he was born blind so that God’s works might be revealed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: We must work the works of him who sent me while it is day; night is coming, when no one can work.
speaker: Narrator

text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had said this, he spat on the ground and made mud with the saliva and spread the mud on the man’s eyes,
speaker: Narrator

text: saying to him, “Go, wash in the pool of Siloam” (which means Sent). Then he went and washed and came back able to see.
speaker: Narrator

text: The neighbors and those who had seen him before as a beggar began to ask, “Is this not the man who used to sit and beg?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some were saying, “It is he.” Others were saying, “No, but it is someone like him.” He kept saying, “I am he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they kept asking him, “Then how were your eyes opened?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “The man called Jesus made mud, spread it on my eyes, and said to me, ‘Go to Siloam and wash.’ Then I went and washed and received my sight.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “Where is he?” He said, “I do not know.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought to the Pharisees the man who had formerly been blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was a Sabbath day when Jesus made the mud and opened his eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Pharisees also began to ask him how he had received his sight. He said to them, “He put mud on my eyes. Then I washed, and now I see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the Pharisees said, “This man is not from God, for he does not observe the Sabbath.” Others said, “How can a man who is a sinner perform such signs?” And they were divided.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they said again to the blind man, “What do you say about him? It was your eyes he opened.” He said, “He is a prophet.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews did not believe that he had been blind and had received his sight until they called the parents of the man who had received his sight
speaker: Narrator

text: and asked them, “Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?”
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents answered, “We know that this is our son and that he was born blind,
speaker: Narrator

text: but we do not know how it is that now he sees, nor do we know who opened his eyes. Ask him; he is of age. He will speak for himself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jews, for the Jews had already agreed that anyone who confessed Jesus to be the Messiah would be put out of the synagogue.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore his parents said, “He is of age; ask him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So for the second time they called the man who had been blind, and they said to him, “Give glory to God! We know that this man is a sinner.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “I do not know whether he is a sinner. One thing I do know, that though I was blind, now I see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to him, “What did he do to you? How did he open your eyes?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered them, “I have told you already, and you would not listen. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also want to become his disciples?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they reviled him, saying, “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God has spoken to Moses, but as for this man, we do not know where he comes from.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The man answered, “Here is an astonishing thing! You do not know where he comes from, yet he opened my eyes.
speaker: Narrator

text: We know that God does not listen to sinners, but he does listen to one who worships him and obeys his will.
speaker: Narrator

text: Never since the world began has it been heard that anyone opened the eyes of a person born blind.
speaker: Narrator

text: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered him, “You were born entirely in sins, and are you trying to teach us?” And they drove him out.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus heard that they had driven him out, and when he found him he said, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: He answered, “And who is he, sir? Tell me, so that I may believe in him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “You have seen him, and the one speaking with you is he.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Lord, I believe.” And he worshiped him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “I came into this world for judgment, so that those who do not see may see and those who do see may become blind.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Some of the Pharisees who were with him heard this and said to him, “Surely we are not blind, are we?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “If you were blind, you would not have sin. But now that you say, ‘We see,’ your sin remains.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Very truly, I tell you, anyone who does not enter the sheepfold by the gate but climbs in by another way is a thief and a bandit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who enters by the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep hear his voice. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he has brought out all his own, he goes ahead of them, and the sheep follow him because they know his voice.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will not follow a stranger, but they will run from him because they do not know the voice of strangers.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus used this figure of speech with them, but they did not understand what he was saying to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: So again Jesus said to them, “Very truly, I tell you, I am the gate for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who came before me are thieves and bandits, but the sheep did not listen to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the gate. Whoever enters by me will be saved and will come in and go out and find pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hired hand, who is not the shepherd and does not own the sheep, sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep and runs away, and the wolf snatches them and scatters them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hired hand runs away because a hired hand does not care for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the good shepherd. I know my own, and my own know me,
speaker: Narrator

text: just as the Father knows me, and I know the Father. And I lay down my life for the sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have other sheep that do not belong to this fold. I must bring them also, and they will listen to my voice. So there will be one flock, one shepherd.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason the Father loves me, because I lay down my life in order to take it up again.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one takes it from me, but I lay it down of my own accord. I have power to lay it down, and I have power to take it up again. I have received this command from my Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again the Jews were divided because of these words.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of them were saying, “He has a demon and is out of his mind. Why listen to him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Others were saying, “These are not the words of one who has a demon. Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time the Festival of the Dedication took place in Jerusalem. It was winter,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Jesus was walking in the temple, in the portico of Solomon.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews gathered around him and said to him, “How long will you keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I have told you, and you do not believe. The works that I do in my Father’s name testify to me,
speaker: Narrator

text: but you do not believe because you do not belong to my sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: My sheep hear my voice. I know them, and they follow me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish. No one will snatch them out of my hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Father, in regard to what he has given me, is greater than all, and no one can snatch them out of the Father’s hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Father and I are one.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews took up stones again to stone him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus replied, “I have shown you many good works from the Father. For which of these are you going to stone me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered, “It is not for a good work that we are going to stone you but for blasphemy, because you, though only a human, are making yourself God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Is it not written in your law, ‘I said, you are gods’?
speaker: Narrator

text: If those to whom the word of God came were called ‘gods’—and the scripture cannot be annulled—
speaker: Narrator

text: can you say that the one whom the Father has sanctified and sent into the world is blaspheming because I said, ‘I am God’s Son’?
speaker: Narrator

text: If I am not doing the works of my Father, then do not believe me.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if I do them, even though you do not believe me, believe the works, so that you may know and understand that the Father is in me and I am in the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they tried to arrest him again, but he escaped from their hands.
speaker: Narrator

text: He went away again across the Jordan to the place where John had been baptizing earlier, and he remained there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Many came to him, and they were saying, “John performed no sign, but everything that John said about this man was true.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And many believed in him there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now a certain man was ill, Lazarus of Bethany, the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary was the one who anointed the Lord with perfume and wiped his feet with her hair; her brother Lazarus was ill.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the sisters sent a message to Jesus, “Lord, he whom you love is ill.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But when Jesus heard it, he said, “This illness does not lead to death; rather, it is for God’s glory, so that the Son of God may be glorified through it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Accordingly, though Jesus loved Martha and her sister and Lazarus,
speaker: Narrator

text: after having heard that Lazarus was ill, he stayed two days longer in the place where he was.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then after this he said to the disciples, “Let us go to Judea again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “Rabbi, the Jews were just now trying to stone you, and are you going there again?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Are there not twelve hours of daylight? Those who walk during the day do not stumble because they see the light of this world.
speaker: Narrator

text: But those who walk at night stumble because the light is not in them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After saying this, he told them, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but I am going there to awaken him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples said to him, “Lord, if he has fallen asleep, he will be all right.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, however, had been speaking about his death, but they thought that he was referring merely to sleep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus told them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: For your sake I am glad I was not there, so that you may believe. But let us go to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas, who was called the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, “Let us also go, that we may die with him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus arrived, he found that Lazarus had already been in the tomb four days.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, some two miles away,
speaker: Narrator

text: and many of the Jews had come to Martha and Mary to console them about their brother.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Martha heard that Jesus was coming, she went and met him, while Mary stayed at home.
speaker: Narrator

text: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.
speaker: Narrator

text: But even now I know that God will give you whatever you ask of him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Your brother will rise again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Martha said to him, “I know that he will rise again in the resurrection on the last day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Those who believe in me, even though they die, will live,
speaker: Narrator

text: and everyone who lives and believes in me will never die. Do you believe this?”
speaker: Narrator

text: She said to him, “Yes, Lord, I believe that you are the Messiah, the Son of God, the one coming into the world.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When she had said this, she went back and called her sister Mary and told her privately, “The Teacher is here and is calling for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And when she heard it, she got up quickly and went to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jesus had not yet come to the village but was still at the place where Martha had met him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews who were with her in the house consoling her saw Mary get up quickly and go out. They followed her because they thought that she was going to the tomb to weep there.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Mary came where Jesus was and saw him, she knelt at his feet and said to him, “Lord, if you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw her weeping and the Jews who came with her also weeping, he was greatly disturbed in spirit and deeply moved.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “Where have you laid him?” They said to him, “Lord, come and see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus began to weep.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Jews said, “See how he loved him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of them said, “Could not he who opened the eyes of the blind man have kept this man from dying?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus, again greatly disturbed, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone was lying against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Take away the stone.” Martha, the sister of the dead man, said to him, “Lord, already there is a stench because he has been dead four days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Did I not tell you that if you believed you would see the glory of God?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So they took away the stone. And Jesus looked upward and said, “Father, I thank you for having heard me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I knew that you always hear me, but I have said this for the sake of the crowd standing here, so that they may believe that you sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had said this, he cried with a loud voice, “Lazarus, come out!”
speaker: Narrator

text: The dead man came out, his hands and feet bound with strips of cloth and his face wrapped in a cloth. Jesus said to them, “Unbind him, and let him go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of the Jews, therefore, who had come with Mary and had seen what Jesus did believed in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But some of them went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief priests and the Pharisees called a meeting of the council and said, “What are we to do? This man is performing many signs.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we let him go on like this, everyone will believe in him, and the Romans will come and destroy both our holy place and our nation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But one of them, Caiaphas, who was high priest that year, said to them, “You know nothing at all!
speaker: Narrator

text: You do not understand that it is better for you to have one man die for the people than to have the whole nation destroyed.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He did not say this on his own, but being high priest that year he prophesied that Jesus was about to die for the nation,
speaker: Narrator

text: and not for the nation only, but to gather into one the dispersed children of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: So from that day on they planned to put him to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus therefore no longer walked about openly among the Jews but went from there to a town called Ephraim in the region near the wilderness, and he remained there with the disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the Passover of the Jews was near, and many went up from the country to Jerusalem before the Passover to purify themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were looking for Jesus and were asking one another as they stood in the temple, “What do you think? Surely he will not come to the festival, will he?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the chief priests and the Pharisees had given orders that anyone who knew where Jesus was should let them know, so that they might arrest him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days before the Passover Jesus came to Bethany, the home of Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they gave a dinner for him. Martha served, and Lazarus was one of those reclining with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary took a pound of costly perfume made of pure nard, anointed Jesus’s feet, and wiped them with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Judas Iscariot, one of his disciples (the one who was about to betray him), said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Why was this perfume not sold for three hundred denarii and the money given to the poor?”
speaker: Narrator

text: (He said this not because he cared about the poor but because he was a thief; he kept the common purse and used to steal what was put into it.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said, “Leave her alone. She bought it so that she might keep it for the day of my burial.
speaker: Narrator

text: You always have the poor with you, but you do not always have me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the great crowd of the Jews learned that he was there, they came not only because of Jesus but also to see Lazarus, whom he had raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the chief priests planned to put Lazarus to death as well,
speaker: Narrator

text: since it was on account of him that many of the Jews were deserting and were believing in Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: The next day the great crowd that had come to the festival heard that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they took branches of palm trees and went out to meet him, shouting,
“Hosanna!
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord—
    the King of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus found a young donkey and sat on it, as it is written:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not be afraid, daughter of Zion.
Look, your king is coming,
    sitting on a donkey’s colt!”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples did not understand these things at first, but when Jesus was glorified, then they remembered that these things had been written of him and had been done to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the crowd that had been with him when he called Lazarus out of the tomb and raised him from the dead continued to testify.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was also because they heard that he had performed this sign that the crowd went to meet him.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Pharisees then said to one another, “You see, you can do nothing. Look, the world has gone after him!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now among those who went up to worship at the festival were some Greeks.
speaker: Narrator

text: They came to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee, and said to him, “Sir, we wish to see Jesus.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip went and told Andrew, then Andrew and Philip went and told Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “The hour has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains just a single grain, but if it dies it bears much fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who love their life lose it, and those who hate their life in this world will keep it for eternal life.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever serves me must follow me, and where I am, there will my servant be also. Whoever serves me, the Father will honor.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now my soul is troubled. And what should I say: ‘Father, save me from this hour’? No, it is for this reason that I have come to this hour.
speaker: Narrator

text: Father, glorify your name.” Then a voice came from heaven, “I have glorified it, and I will glorify it again.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd standing there heard it and said that it was thunder. Others said, “An angel has spoken to him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “This voice has come for your sake, not for mine.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now is the judgment of this world; now the ruler of this world will be driven out.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I, when I am lifted up from the earth, will draw all people to myself.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said this to indicate the kind of death he was to die.
speaker: Narrator

text: The crowd answered him, “We have heard from the law that the Messiah remains forever. How can you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is this Son of Man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “The light is in you for a little longer. Walk while you have the light, so that the darkness may not overtake you. If you walk in the darkness, you do not know where you are going.
speaker: Narrator

text:
While you have the light, believe in the light, so that you may become children of light.”
After Jesus had said this, he departed and hid from them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although he had performed so many signs in their presence, they did not believe in him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This was to fulfill the word spoken by the prophet Isaiah:
“Lord, who has believed our message,
    and to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And so they could not believe, because Isaiah also said,
speaker: Narrator

text:
“He has blinded their eyes
    and hardened their heart,
so that they might not look with their eyes
    and understand with their heart and turn—
    and I would heal them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Isaiah said this because he saw his glory and spoke about him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless many, even of the authorities, believed in him. But because of the Pharisees they did not confess it, for fear that they would be put out of the synagogue,
speaker: Narrator

text: for they loved human glory more than the glory that comes from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus cried aloud: “Whoever believes in me believes not in me but in him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whoever sees me sees him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have come as light into the world, so that everyone who believes in me should not remain in the darkness.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not judge anyone who hears my words and does not keep them, for I came not to judge the world but to save the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: The one who rejects me and does not receive my words has a judge; on the last day the word that I have spoken will serve as judge,
speaker: Narrator

text: for I have not spoken on my own, but the Father who sent me has himself given me a commandment about what to say and what to speak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I know that his commandment is eternal life. What I speak, therefore, I speak just as the Father has told me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now before the festival of the Passover, Jesus knew that his hour had come to depart from this world and go to the Father. Having loved his own who were in the world, he loved them to the end.
speaker: Narrator

text: The devil had already decided that Judas son of Simon Iscariot would betray Jesus. And during supper
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus, knowing that the Father had given all things into his hands and that he had come from God and was going to God,
speaker: Narrator

text: got up from supper, took off his outer robe, and tied a towel around himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he poured water into a basin and began to wash the disciples’ feet and to wipe them with the towel that was tied around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He came to Simon Peter, who said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “You do not know now what I am doing, but later you will understand.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “You will never wash my feet.” Jesus answered, “Unless I wash you, you have no share with me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, not my feet only but also my hands and my head!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “One who has bathed does not need to wash, except for the feet, but is entirely clean. And you are clean, though not all of you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For he knew who was to betray him; for this reason he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he had washed their feet, had put on his robe, and had reclined again, he said to them, “Do you know what I have done to you?
speaker: Narrator

text: You call me Teacher and Lord, and you are right, for that is what I am.
speaker: Narrator

text: So if I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you also ought to wash one another’s feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I have set you an example, that you also should do as I have done to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, slaves are not greater than their master, nor are messengers greater than the one who sent them.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you know these things, you are blessed if you do them.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not speaking of all of you; I know whom I have chosen. But it is to fulfill the scripture, ‘The one who ate my bread has lifted his heel against me.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I tell you this now, before it occurs, so that when it does occur you may believe that I am he.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, whoever receives one whom I send receives me, and whoever receives me receives him who sent me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After saying this Jesus was troubled in spirit and declared, “Very truly, I tell you, one of you will betray me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The disciples looked at one another, uncertain of whom he was speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: One of his disciples—the one whom Jesus loved—was reclining close to his heart;
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter therefore motioned to him to ask Jesus of whom he was speaking.
speaker: Narrator

text: So while reclining next to Jesus, he asked him, “Lord, who is it?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “It is the one to whom I give this piece of bread when I have dipped it in the dish.” So when he had dipped the piece of bread, he gave it to Judas son of Simon Iscariot.
speaker: Narrator

text: After he received the piece of bread, Satan entered into him. Jesus said to him, “Do quickly what you are going to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now no one knew why he said this to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Some thought that, because Judas had the common purse, Jesus was telling him, “Buy what we need for the festival,” or that he should give something to the poor.
speaker: Narrator

text: So, after receiving the piece of bread, he immediately went out. And it was night.
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had gone out, Jesus said, “Now the Son of Man has been glorified, and God has been glorified in him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If God has been glorified in him, God will also glorify him in himself and will glorify him at once.
speaker: Narrator

text: Little children, I am with you only a little longer. You will look for me, and as I said to the Jews so now I say to you, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I give you a new commandment, that you love one another. Just as I have loved you, you also should love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: By this everyone will know that you are my disciples, if you have love for one another.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter said to him, “Lord, where are you going?” Jesus answered, “Where I am going, you cannot follow me now, but you will follow afterward.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter said to him, “Lord, why can I not follow you now? I will lay down my life for you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Will you lay down your life for me? Very truly, I tell you, before the cock crows, you will have denied me three times.
speaker: Narrator
