text: “Do not let your hearts be troubled. Believe in God; believe also in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: In my Father’s house there are many dwelling places. If it were not so, would I have told you that I go to prepare a place for you?
speaker: Narrator

text: And if I go and prepare a place for you, I will come again and will take you to myself, so that where I am, there you may be also.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you know the way to the place where I am going.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas said to him, “Lord, we do not know where you are going. How can we know the way?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “I am the way and the truth and the life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you know me, you will know my Father also. From now on you do know him and have seen him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Philip said to him, “Lord, show us the Father, and we will be satisfied.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you all this time, Philip, and you still do not know me? Whoever has seen me has seen the Father. How can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Do you not believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words that I say to you I do not speak on my own, but the Father who dwells in me does his works.
speaker: Narrator

text: Believe me that I am in the Father and the Father is in me, but if you do not, then believe because of the works themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, the one who believes in me will also do the works that I do and, in fact, will do greater works than these, because I am going to the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will do whatever you ask in my name, so that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
speaker: Narrator

text: If in my name you ask me for anything, I will do it.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If you love me, you will keep my commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate, to be with you forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the Spirit of truth, whom the world cannot receive because it neither sees him nor knows him. You know him because he abides with you, and he will be in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I will not leave you orphaned; I am coming to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In a little while the world will no longer see me, but you will see me; because I live, you also will live.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day you will know that I am in my Father, and you in me, and I in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: They who have my commandments and keep them are those who love me, and those who love me will be loved by my Father, and I will love them and reveal myself to them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Judas (not Iscariot) said to him, “Lord, how is it that you will reveal yourself to us and not to the world?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “Those who love me will keep my word, and my Father will love them, and we will come to them and make our home with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever does not love me does not keep my words, and the word that you hear is not mine but is from the Father who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have said these things to you while I am still with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit, whom the Father will send in my name, will teach you everything and remind you of all that I have said to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Peace I leave with you; my peace I give to you. I do not give to you as the world gives. Do not let your hearts be troubled, and do not let them be afraid.
speaker: Narrator

text: You heard me say to you, ‘I am going away, and I am coming to you.’ If you loved me, you would rejoice that I am going to the Father, because the Father is greater than I.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I have told you this before it occurs, so that when it does occur you may believe.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will no longer talk much with you, for the ruler of this world is coming. He has no power over me,
speaker: Narrator

text: but I do as the Father has commanded me, so that the world may know that I love the Father. Rise, let us be on our way.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I am the true vine, and my Father is the vinegrower.
speaker: Narrator

text: He removes every branch in me that bears no fruit. Every branch that bears fruit he prunes to make it bear more fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: You have already been cleansed by the word that I have spoken to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Abide in me as I abide in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit by itself unless it abides in the vine, neither can you unless you abide in me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am the vine; you are the branches. Those who abide in me and I in them bear much fruit, because apart from me you can do nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever does not abide in me is thrown away like a branch and withers; such branches are gathered, thrown into the fire, and burned.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you abide in me and my words abide in you, ask for whatever you wish, and it will be done for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: My Father is glorified by this, that you bear much fruit and become my disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Father has loved me, so I have loved you; abide in my love.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you keep my commandments, you will abide in my love, just as I have kept my Father’s commandments and abide in his love.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said these things to you so that my joy may be in you and that your joy may be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is my commandment, that you love one another as I have loved you.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one has greater love than this, to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are my friends if you do what I command you.
speaker: Narrator

text: I do not call you servants any longer, because the servant does not know what the master is doing, but I have called you friends, because I have made known to you everything that I have heard from my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: You did not choose me, but I chose you. And I appointed you to go and bear fruit, fruit that will last, so that the Father will give you whatever you ask him in my name.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am giving you these commands so that you may love one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: “If the world hates you, be aware that it hated me before it hated you.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you belonged to the world, the world would love you as its own. Because you do not belong to the world, but I have chosen you out of the world, therefore the world hates you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the word that I said to you, ‘Slaves are not greater than their master.’ If they persecuted me, they will persecute you; if they kept my word, they will keep yours also.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will do all these things to you on account of my name, because they do not know him who sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not come and spoken to them, they would not have sin, but now they have no excuse for their sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever hates me hates my Father also.
speaker: Narrator

text: If I had not done among them the works that no one else did, they would not have sin. But now they have seen and hated both me and my Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was to fulfill the word that is written in their law, ‘They hated me without a cause.’
speaker: Narrator

text: “When the Advocate comes, whom I will send to you from the Father, the Spirit of truth who comes from the Father, he will testify on my behalf.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also are to testify, because you have been with me from the beginning.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have said these things to you to keep you from falling away.
speaker: Narrator

text: They will put you out of the synagogues. Indeed, an hour is coming when those who kill you will think that by doing so they are offering worship to God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they will do this because they have not known the Father or me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I have said these things to you so that when their hour comes you may remember that I told you about them.
“I did not say these things to you from the beginning, because I was with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now I am going to him who sent me, yet none of you asks me, ‘Where are you going?’
speaker: Narrator

text: But because I have said these things to you, sorrow has filled your hearts.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, I tell you the truth: it is to your advantage that I go away, for if I do not go away, the Advocate will not come to you, but if I go, I will send him to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he comes, he will prove the world wrong about sin and righteousness and judgment:
speaker: Narrator

text: about sin, because they do not believe in me;
speaker: Narrator

text: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father, and you will see me no longer;
speaker: Narrator

text: about judgment, because the ruler of this world has been condemned.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I still have many things to say to you, but you cannot bear them now.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all the truth, for he will not speak on his own but will speak whatever he hears, and he will declare to you the things that are to come.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will glorify me because he will take what is mine and declare it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: All that the Father has is mine. For this reason I said that he will take what is mine and declare it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “A little while, and you will no longer see me, and again a little while, and you will see me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then some of his disciples said to one another, “What does he mean by saying to us, ‘A little while, and you will no longer see me, and again a little while, and you will see me,’ and ‘because I am going to the Father’?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “What does he mean by this ‘a little while’? We do not know what he is talking about.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus knew that they wanted to ask him, so he said to them, “Are you discussing among yourselves what I meant when I said, ‘A little while, and you will no longer see me, and again a little while, and you will see me’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, you will weep and mourn, but the world will rejoice; you will have pain, but your pain will turn into joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: When a woman is in labor, she has pain because her hour has come. But when her child is born, she no longer remembers the anguish because of the joy of having brought a human being into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you have pain now, but I will see you again, and your hearts will rejoice, and no one will take your joy from you.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day you will ask nothing of me. Very truly, I tell you, if you ask anything of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Until now you have not asked for anything in my name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be complete.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have said these things to you in figures of speech. The hour is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figures but will tell you plainly of the Father.
speaker: Narrator

text: On that day you will ask in my name. I do not say to you that I will ask the Father on your behalf,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the Father himself loves you because you have loved me and have believed that I came from God.
speaker: Narrator

text: I came from the Father and have come into the world; again, I am leaving the world and am going to the Father.”
speaker: Narrator

text: His disciples said, “Yes, now you are speaking plainly, not in any figure of speech!
speaker: Narrator

text: Now we know that you know all things and do not need to have anyone question you; by this we believe that you came from God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered them, “Do you now believe?
speaker: Narrator

text: The hour is coming, indeed it has come, when you will be scattered, each one to his home, and you will leave me alone. Yet I am not alone because the Father is with me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have said this to you so that in me you may have peace. In the world you face persecution, but take courage: I have conquered the world!”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had spoken these words, he looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the hour has come; glorify your Son so that the Son may glorify you,
speaker: Narrator

text: since you have given him authority over all people, to give eternal life to all whom you have given him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is eternal life, that they may know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, whom you have sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: I glorified you on earth by finishing the work that you gave me to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: So now, Father, glorify me in your own presence with the glory that I had in your presence before the world existed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I have made your name known to those whom you gave me from the world. They were yours, and you gave them to me, and they have kept your word.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they know that everything you have given me is from you,
speaker: Narrator

text: for the words that you gave to me I have given to them, and they have received them and know in truth that I came from you, and they have believed that you sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am asking on their behalf; I am not asking on behalf of the world but on behalf of those whom you gave me, because they are yours.
speaker: Narrator

text: All mine are yours, and yours are mine, and I have been glorified in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to you. Holy Father, protect them in your name that you have given me, so that they may be one, as we are one.
speaker: Narrator

text: While I was with them, I protected them in your name that you have given me. I guarded them, and not one of them was lost except the one destined to be lost, so that the scripture might be fulfilled.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now I am coming to you, and I speak these things in the world so that they may have my joy made complete in themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have given them your word, and the world has hated them because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am not asking you to take them out of the world, but I ask you to protect them from the evil one.
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sanctify them in the truth; your word is truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you have sent me into the world, so I have sent them into the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for their sakes I sanctify myself, so that they also may be sanctified in truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: “I ask not only on behalf of these but also on behalf of those who believe in me through their word,
speaker: Narrator

text: that they may all be one. As you, Father, are in me and I am in you, may they also be in us, so that the world may believe that you have sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: The glory that you have given me I have given them, so that they may be one, as we are one,
speaker: Narrator

text: I in them and you in me, that they may become completely one, so that the world may know that you have sent me and have loved them even as you have loved me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Father, I desire that those also, whom you have given me, may be with me where I am, to see my glory, which you have given me because you loved me before the foundation of the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Righteous Father, the world does not know you, but I know you, and these know that you have sent me.
speaker: Narrator

text: I made your name known to them, and I will make it known, so that the love with which you have loved me may be in them and I in them.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After Jesus had spoken these words, he went out with his disciples across the Kidron Valley to a place where there was a garden, which he and his disciples entered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Judas, who betrayed him, also knew the place because Jesus often met there with his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Judas brought a detachment of soldiers together with police from the chief priests and the Pharisees, and they came there with lanterns and torches and weapons.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Jesus, knowing all that was to happen to him, came forward and asked them, “Whom are you looking for?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered, “Jesus of Nazareth.” Jesus replied, “I am he.” Judas, who betrayed him, was standing with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus said to them, “I am he,” they stepped back and fell to the ground.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again he asked them, “Whom are you looking for?” And they said, “Jesus of Nazareth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I told you that I am he. So if you are looking for me, let these people go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: This was to fulfill the word that he had spoken, “I did not lose a single one of those whom you gave me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it, struck the high priest’s slave, and cut off his right ear. The slave’s name was Malchus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back into its sheath. Am I not to drink the cup that the Father has given me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the soldiers, their officer, and the Jewish police arrested Jesus and bound him.
speaker: Narrator

text: First they took him to Annas, who was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it was better to have one person die for the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter and another disciple followed Jesus. Since that disciple was known to the high priest, he went with Jesus into the courtyard of the high priest,
speaker: Narrator

text: but Peter was standing outside at the gate. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out, spoke to the woman who guarded the gate, and brought Peter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: The woman said to Peter, “You are not also one of this man’s disciples, are you?” He said, “I am not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the slaves and the police had made a charcoal fire because it was cold, and they were standing around it and warming themselves. Peter also was standing with them and warming himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the high priest questioned Jesus about his disciples and about his teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “I have spoken openly to the world; I have always taught in synagogues and in the temple, where all the Jews come together. I have said nothing in secret.
speaker: Narrator

text: Why do you ask me? Ask those who heard what I said to them; they know what I said.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had said this, one of the police standing nearby struck Jesus on the face, saying, “Is that how you answer the high priest?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “If I have spoken wrongly, testify to the wrong. But if I have spoken rightly, why do you strike me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Annas sent him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They asked him, “You are not also one of his disciples, are you?” He denied it and said, “I am not.”
speaker: Narrator

text: One of the slaves of the high priest, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, asked, “Did I not see you in the garden with him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Again Peter denied it, and at that moment the cock crowed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they took Jesus from Caiaphas to Pilate’s headquarters. It was early in the morning. They themselves did not enter the headquarters, so as to avoid ritual defilement and to be able to eat the Passover.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Pilate went out to them and said, “What accusation do you bring against this man?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They answered, “If this man were not a criminal, we would not have handed him over to you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and judge him according to your law.” The Jews replied, “We are not permitted to put anyone to death.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (This was to fulfill what Jesus had said when he indicated the kind of death he was to die.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate entered the headquarters again, summoned Jesus, and asked him, “Are you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “Do you ask this on your own, or did others tell you about me?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate replied, “I am not a Jew, am I? Your own nation and the chief priests have handed you over to me. What have you done?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered, “My kingdom does not belong to this world. If my kingdom belonged to this world, my followers would be fighting to keep me from being handed over to the Jews. But as it is, my kingdom is not from here.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate asked him, “So you are a king?” Jesus answered, “You say that I am a king. For this I was born, and for this I came into the world, to testify to the truth. Everyone who belongs to the truth listens to my voice.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Pilate asked him, “What is truth?”
After he had said this, he went out to the Jews again and told them, “I find no case against him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But you have a custom that I release someone for you at the Passover. Do you want me to release for you the King of the Jews?”
speaker: Narrator

text: They shouted in reply, “Not this man but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a rebel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Pilate took Jesus and had him flogged.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the soldiers wove a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and they dressed him in a purple robe.
speaker: Narrator

text: They kept coming up to him, saying, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and striking him on the face.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate went out again and said to them, “Look, I am bringing him out to you to let you know that I find no case against him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Behold the man!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the chief priests and the police saw him, they shouted, “Crucify him! Crucify him!” Pilate said to them, “Take him yourselves and crucify him; I find no case against him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Jews answered him, “We have a law, and according to that law he ought to die because he has claimed to be the Son of God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Pilate heard this, he was more afraid than ever.
speaker: Narrator

text: He entered his headquarters again and asked Jesus, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave him no answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate therefore said to him, “Do you refuse to speak to me? Do you not know that I have power to release you and power to crucify you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus answered him, “You would have no power over me unless it had been given you from above; therefore the one who handed me over to you is guilty of a greater sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: From then on Pilate tried to release him, but the Jews cried out, “If you release this man, you are no friend of Caesar. Everyone who claims to be a king sets himself against Caesar.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus outside and sat on the judge’s bench at a place called The Stone Pavement, or in Hebrew Gabbatha.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now it was the day of Preparation for the Passover, and it was about noon. He said to the Jews, “Here is your King!”
speaker: Narrator

text: They cried out, “Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!” Pilate asked them, “Shall I crucify your King?” The chief priests answered, “We have no king but Caesar.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then he handed him over to them to be crucified.
So they took Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and carrying the cross by himself he went out to what is called the Place of the Skull, which in Hebrew is called Golgotha.
speaker: Narrator

text: There they crucified him and with him two others, one on either side, with Jesus between them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate also had an inscription written and put on the cross. It read, “Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Many of the Jews read this inscription because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Hebrew, in Latin, and in Greek.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Do not write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but, ‘This man said, I am King of the Jews.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Pilate answered, “What I have written I have written.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they took his clothes and divided them into four parts, one for each soldier. They also took his tunic; now the tunic was seamless, woven in one piece from the top.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So they said to one another, “Let us not tear it but cast lots for it to see who will get it.” This was to fulfill what the scripture says,
“They divided my clothes among themselves,
    and for my clothing they cast lots.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And that is what the soldiers did.
Meanwhile, standing near the cross of Jesus were his mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus saw his mother and the disciple whom he loved standing beside her, he said to his mother, “Woman, here is your son.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to the disciple, “Here is your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his own home.
speaker: Narrator

text: After this, when Jesus knew that all was now finished, he said (in order to fulfill the scripture), “I am thirsty.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A jar full of sour wine was standing there. So they put a sponge full of the wine on a branch of hyssop and held it to his mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Jesus had received the wine, he said, “It is finished.” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: Since it was the day of Preparation, the Jews did not want the bodies left on the cross during the Sabbath, especially because that Sabbath was a day of great solemnity. So they asked Pilate to have the legs of the crucified men broken and the bodies removed.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first and of the other who had been crucified with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when they came to Jesus and saw that he was already dead, they did not break his legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Instead, one of the soldiers pierced his side with a spear, and at once blood and water came out.
speaker: Narrator

text: (He who saw this has testified so that you also may believe. His testimony is true, and he knows that he tells the truth, so that you also may continue to believe.)
speaker: Narrator

text: These things occurred so that the scripture might be fulfilled, “None of his bones shall be broken.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And again another passage of scripture says, “They will look on the one whom they have pierced.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus, though a secret one because of his fear of the Jews, asked Pilate to let him take away the body of Jesus. Pilate gave him permission, so he came and removed his body.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nicodemus, who had at first come to Jesus by night, also came, bringing a mixture of myrrh and aloes, weighing about a hundred pounds.
speaker: Narrator

text: They took the body of Jesus and wrapped it with the spices in linen cloths, according to the burial custom of the Jews.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there was a garden in the place where he was crucified, and in the garden there was a new tomb in which no one had ever been laid.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so, because it was the Jewish day of Preparation and the tomb was nearby, they laid Jesus there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Early on the first day of the week, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been removed from the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: So she ran and went to Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one whom Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have laid him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Peter and the other disciple set out and went toward the tomb.
speaker: Narrator

text: The two were running together, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.
speaker: Narrator

text: He bent down to look in and saw the linen wrappings lying there, but he did not go in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Simon Peter came, following him, and went into the tomb. He saw the linen wrappings lying there,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the cloth that had been on Jesus’s head, not lying with the linen wrappings but rolled up in a place by itself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the other disciple, who reached the tomb first, also went in, and he saw and believed,
speaker: Narrator

text: for as yet they did not understand the scripture, that he must rise from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the disciples returned to their homes.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Mary stood weeping outside the tomb. As she wept, she bent over to look into the tomb,
speaker: Narrator

text: and she saw two angels in white sitting where the body of Jesus had been lying, one at the head and the other at the feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping?” She said to them, “They have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have laid him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When she had said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, but she did not know that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Woman, why are you weeping? Whom are you looking for?” Supposing him to be the gardener, she said to him, “Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have laid him, and I will take him away.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Mary!” She turned and said to him in Hebrew, “Rabbouni!” (which means Teacher).
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to her, “Do not touch me, because I have not yet ascended to the Father. But go to my brothers and say to them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord,” and she told them that he had said these things to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: When it was evening on that day, the first day of the week, and the doors were locked where the disciples were, for fear of the Jews, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: After he said this, he showed them his hands and his side. Then the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them again, “Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, so I send you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When he had said this, he breathed on them and said to them, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Thomas (who was called the Twin), one of the twelve, was not with them when Jesus came.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the other disciples told him, “We have seen the Lord.” But he said to them, “Unless I see the mark of the nails in his hands and put my finger in the mark of the nails and my hand in his side, I will not believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A week later his disciples were again in the house, and Thomas was with them. Although the doors were shut, Jesus came and stood among them and said, “Peace be with you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here and see my hands. Reach out your hand and put it in my side. Do not doubt but believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Thomas answered him, “My Lord and my God!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “Have you believed because you have seen me? Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have come to believe.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jesus did many other signs in the presence of his disciples that are not written in this book.
speaker: Narrator

text: But these are written so that you may continue to believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that through believing you may have life in his name.
speaker: Narrator

text: After these things Jesus showed himself again to the disciples by the Sea of Tiberias, and he showed himself in this way.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gathered there together were Simon Peter, Thomas called the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two others of his disciples.
speaker: Narrator

text: Simon Peter said to them, “I am going fishing.” They said to him, “We will go with you.” They went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Just after daybreak, Jesus stood on the beach, but the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Children, you have no fish, have you?” They answered him, “No.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Cast the net to the right side of the boat, and you will find some.” So they cast it, and now they were not able to haul it in because there were so many fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: That disciple whom Jesus loved said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his outer garment, for he had taken it off, and jumped into the sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the other disciples came in the boat, dragging the net full of fish, for they were not far from the land, only about a hundred yards off.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had gone ashore, they saw a charcoal fire there, with fish on it, and bread.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Bring some of the fish that you have just caught.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Simon Peter went aboard and hauled the net ashore, full of large fish, a hundred fifty-three of them, and though there were so many, the net was not torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to them, “Come and have breakfast.” Now none of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” because they knew it was the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus came and took the bread and gave it to them and did the same with the fish.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was now the third time that Jesus appeared to the disciples after he was raised from the dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had finished breakfast, Jesus said to Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my lambs.”
speaker: Narrator

text: A second time he said to him, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” He said to him, “Yes, Lord; you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Tend my sheep.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to him the third time, “Simon son of John, do you love me?” Peter felt hurt because he said to him the third time, “Do you love me?” And he said to him, “Lord, you know everything; you know that I love you.” Jesus said to him, “Feed my sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text: Very truly, I tell you, when you were younger, you used to fasten your own belt and to go wherever you wished. But when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands, and someone else will fasten a belt around you and take you where you do not wish to go.”
speaker: Narrator

text: (He said this to indicate the kind of death by which he would glorify God.) After this he said to him, “Follow me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Peter turned and saw the disciple whom Jesus loved following them; he was the one who had reclined next to Jesus at the supper and had said, “Lord, who is it that is going to betray you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Peter saw him, he said to Jesus, “Lord, what about him?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Jesus said to him, “If it is my will that he remain until I come, what is that to you? Follow me!”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the rumor spread among the brothers and sisters that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not say to him that he would not die, but, “If it is my will that he remain until I come, what is that to you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the disciple who is testifying to these things and has written them, and we know that his testimony is true.
speaker: Narrator

text: But there are also many other things that Jesus did; if every one of them were written down, I suppose that the world itself could not contain the books that would be written.
speaker: Narrator
